00506 
00507 // grabbed from SDL_ttf (also LGPL)
00508 static void UNICODE_to_UTF8(unsigned char *utf8, UnicodeChar unicode)
00509 {
00510     int j=0;
00511  
00512     if (unicode < 0x80)
00513     {
00514         utf8[j] = unicode & 0x7F;
00515     }
00516     else if (unicode < 0x800)
00517     {
00518         utf8[j] = 0xC0 | (unicode >> 6);
00519         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | (unicode & 0x3F);
00520     }
00521     else if (unicode < 0x10000)
00522     {
00523         utf8[j] = 0xE0 | (unicode >> 12);
00524         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | ((unicode >> 6) & 0x3F);
00525         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | (unicode & 0x3F);
00526     }
00527     else if (unicode < 0x200000)
00528     {
00529         utf8[j] = 0xF0 | (unicode >> 18);
00530         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | ((unicode >> 12) & 0x3F);
00531         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | ((unicode >> 6) & 0x3F);
00532         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | (unicode & 0x3F);
00533     }
00534     else if (unicode < 0x4000000)
00535     {
00536         utf8[j] = 0xF8 | (unicode >> 24);
00537         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | ((unicode >> 18) & 0x3F);
00538         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | ((unicode >> 12) & 0x3F);
00539         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | ((unicode >> 6) & 0x3F);
00540         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | (unicode & 0x3F);
00541     }
00542     else if (unicode < 0x80000000)
00543     {
00544         utf8[j] = 0xFC | (unicode >> 30);
00545         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | ((unicode >> 24) & 0x3F);
00546         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | ((unicode >> 18) & 0x3F);
00547         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | ((unicode >> 12) & 0x3F);
00548         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | ((unicode >> 6) & 0x3F);
00549         utf8[++j] = 0x80 | (unicode & 0x3F);
00550     }
00551     else
00552      utf8[j] = 0;
00553  
00554     utf8[++j] = 0;
00555 }
00556 
00557 /////////////////
00558 // Convert unicode to UTF8
00559 std::string GetUtf8FromUnicode(UnicodeChar ch) {
00560  if(ch == 0) return std::string("\0", 1);
00561  unsigned char utf8[7];
00562  UNICODE_to_UTF8(utf8, ch);
00563  return (const char*)utf8;
00564 }
00565 
00566 
00567 ////////////////////
00568 // Convert UTF8 to unicode (takes iterator pointing to the first UTF8-encoded character)
00569 UnicodeChar GetNextUnicodeFromUtf8(std::string::const_iterator &it, const std::string::const_iterator& last, size_t& num_skipped) {
00570  num_skipped = 0;
00571  if(it == last) return 0;
00572  
00573  unsigned char ch = *it;
00574  UnicodeChar res = ch;
00575  if ( ch >= 0xFC ) {
00576   res  =  (ch&0x01) << 30; it++; num_skipped++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00577   res |=  (ch&0x3F) << 24; it++; num_skipped++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00578   res |=  (ch&0x3F) << 18; it++; num_skipped++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00579   res |=  (ch&0x3F) << 12; it++; num_skipped++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00580   res |=  (ch&0x3F) << 6; it++;  num_skipped++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00581   res |=  (ch&0x3F);
00582  } else
00583   if ( ch >= 0xF8 ) {
00584    res  =  (ch&0x03) << 24; num_skipped++; it++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00585    res |=  (ch&0x3F) << 18; num_skipped++; it++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00586    res |=  (ch&0x3F) << 12; num_skipped++; it++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00587    res |=  (ch&0x3F) << 6;  num_skipped++; it++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00588    res |=  (ch&0x3F);
00589   } else
00590    if ( ch >= 0xF0 ) {
00591     res  =  (ch&0x07) << 18; it++; num_skipped++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00592     res |=  (ch&0x3F) << 12; it++; num_skipped++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00593     res |=  (ch&0x3F) << 6; it++;  num_skipped++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00594     res |=  (ch&0x3F);
00595    } else
00596     if ( ch >= 0xE0 ) {
00597      res  =  (ch&0x0F) << 12; it++; num_skipped++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00598      res |=  (ch&0x3F) << 6; it++; num_skipped++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00599      res |=  (ch&0x3F);
00600     } else
00601      if ( ch >= 0xC0 ) {
00602       res  =  (ch&0x1F) << 6; it++; num_skipped++; if(it == last) return 0; ch = *it;
00603       res |=  (ch&0x3F);
00604      }
00605  
00606  it++; num_skipped++;
00607  return res;
00608 }
00609 
00610 // Conversion functions
00611 
00612 ////////////////////////////
00613 // Finds an index for the character in conversion table, returns -1 if not found
00614 int FindTableIndex(UnicodeChar c)
00615 {
00616  int left, right, middle;
00617  
00618  left = 0;
00619  right = sizeof(tConversionTable)/sizeof(ConversionItem) - 1;
00620  
00621  // Binary search
00622  while (left <= right)  {
00623   middle = (left + right) / 2;
00624   if (tConversionTable[middle].Unicode == c)
00625    return middle;
00626   
00627   if (c < tConversionTable[middle].Unicode)
00628    right = middle - 1;
00629   else
00630    left = middle + 1;
00631  }
00632  
00633  return -1; // No conversion available
00634 }
00635 
00636 /////////////////////////
00637 // Converts given unicode character to ascii, according to conversion table
00638 // If impossible to convert, returns 0xFF
00639 char UnicodeCharToAsciiChar(UnicodeChar c)
00640 {
00641  // Regular ascii, just continue
00642  if (c <= 0x80)
00643   return (char) c;
00644  
00645  
00646  // Unicode, try to convert
00647  int index = FindTableIndex(c);
00648  if (index == -1)  // Cannot convert
00649   return (char)0xFF;
00650  else
00651   return tConversionTable[index].Ascii;
00652  
00653 }
00654 
00655 ////////////////////////
00656 // Like tolower() but for all international characters
00657 UnicodeChar UnicodeToLower(UnicodeChar c)
00658 {
00659  // ASCII
00660  if (c < 0xC0)
00661   return (UnicodeChar)tolower(c);
00662  
00663  // Who the hell invented so crazzy mappings? :S
00664  
00665  // European characters
00666  if (c >= 0xC0 && c <= 0xD6)
00667   return c + 0x20;
00668  
00669  if (c >= 0xD8 && c <= 0xDE)
00670   return c + 0x20;
00671  
00672  if (c >= 0x100 && c <= 0x177 && !(c & 1))
00673   return c + 1;
00674  
00675  if (c == 0x178)
00676   return 0xFF;
00677  
00678  if (c >= 0x179 && c <= 0x17E && (c & 1))
00679   return c + 1;
00680  
00681  if (c == 0x18F)
00682   return 0x259;
00683  
00684  if (c >= 0x1A0 && c <= 0x1FF && !(c & 1))
00685   return c + 1;
00686  
00687  // Greece alphabet
00688  if (c == 0x386)
00689   return 0x3AC;
00690  
00691  if (c >= 0x388 && c <= 0x38A)
00692   return c + 0x25;
00693  
00694  if (c >= 0x38C && c <= 0x38F)
00695   return c + 0x40;
00696  
00697  if (c >= 0x391 && c <= 0x3AB)
00698   return c + 0x1B;
00699  
00700  // Cyrilic
00701  if (c >= 0x401 && c <= 0x40F)
00702   return c + 0x50;
00703  
00704  if (c >= 0x410 && c <= 0x42F)
00705   return c + 0x20;
00706  
00707  if (c >= 0x490 && c <= 0x4E9 && !(c & 1))
00708   return c + 1;
00709  
00710  // More European characters
00711  if (c >= 0x1E80 && c <= 0x1EF9 && !(c & 1))
00712   return c + 1;
00713  
00714  // This character doesn't have lowercase
00715  return c;
00716 }
00717 
00718 ////////////////////////
00719 // Like toupper() but for all international characters
00720 UnicodeChar UnicodeToUpper(UnicodeChar c)
00721 {
00722  // ASCII
00723  if (c < 0xC0)
00724   return (UnicodeChar)toupper(c);
00725  
00726  // Who the hell invented so crazzy mappings? :S
00727  
00728  // European characters
00729  if (c >= 0xE0 && c <= 0xF6)
00730   return c - 0x20;
00731  
00732  if (c >= 0xF8 && c <= 0xFE)
00733   return c - 0x20;
00734  
00735  if (c == 0xFF)
00736   return 0x178;
00737  
00738  if (c >= 0x100 && c <= 0x177 && (c & 1))
00739   return c - 1;
00740  
00741  if (c >= 0x179 && c <= 0x17E && !(c & 1))
00742   return c - 1;
00743  
00744  if (c == 0x259)
00745   return 0x18F;
00746  
00747  if (c >= 0x1A0 && c <= 0x1FF && (c & 1))
00748   return c - 1;
00749  
00750  // Greece alphabet
00751  if (c == 0x3AC)
00752   return 0x386;
00753  
00754  if (c >= 0x3AD && c <= 0x3AF)
00755   return c - 0x25;
00756  
00757  if (c >= 0x3CC && c <= 0x3CF)
00758   return c - 0x40;
00759  
00760  if (c >= 0x3B1 && c <= 0x3CB)
00761   return c - 0x1B;
00762  
00763  // Cyrilic
00764  if (c >= 0x451 && c <= 0x45F)
00765   return c - 0x50;
00766  
00767  if (c >= 0x430 && c <= 0x44F)
00768   return c - 0x20;
00769  
00770  if (c >= 0x490 && c <= 0x4E9 && (c & 1))
00771   return c - 1;
00772  
00773  // More European characters
00774  if (c >= 0x1E80 && c <= 0x1EF9 && (c & 1))
00775   return c - 1;
00776  
00777  // This character doesn't have uppercase
00778  return c;
00779 }
00780 
00781 /////////////////////////
00782 // Find a substring in a string (case insensitive)
00783 // Handles UTF8 strings correctly
00784 size_t Utf8StringCaseFind(const std::string& text, const std::string& search_for)
00785 {
00786  // HINT: same as stringcasefind, only using UTF8 functions instead (a bit slower)
00787  size_t search_for_size = Utf8StringSize(search_for);
00788  
00789  if (text.size() == 0 || search_for_size == 0 || search_for_size > Utf8StringSize(text))
00790   return std::string::npos;
00791  
00792  std::string::const_iterator it1 = text.begin();
00793  std::string::const_iterator it2 = search_for.begin();
00794  
00795  size_t number_of_same = 0;
00796  size_t number_of_same_bytes = 0;
00797  size_t result = 0;
00798  
00799  // Go through the text
00800  while (it1 != text.end())  {
00801   size_t num_skipped = 0;
00802   UnicodeChar c1 = UnicodeToLower(GetNextUnicodeFromUtf8(it1, text.end(), num_skipped));
00803   UnicodeChar c2 = UnicodeToLower(GetNextUnicodeFromUtf8(it2, search_for.end()));
00804   
00805   // The two characters are the same
00806   if (c1 == c2)  {
00807    number_of_same++;  // If number of same characters equals to the size of the substring, we've found it!
00808    if (number_of_same == search_for_size)
00809     return result - number_of_same_bytes;
00810    number_of_same_bytes += num_skipped;
00811   } else {
00812    number_of_same = 0;
00813    number_of_same_bytes = 0;
00814    it2 = search_for.begin();
00815   }
00816   
00817   result += num_skipped;
00818  }
00819  
00820  return std::string::npos; // Not found
00821 }
00822 
00823 /////////////////////////
00824 // Converts the Utf8 encoded string to format that will display correctly in old LX
00825 std::string OldLxCompatibleString(const std::string &Utf8String)
00826 {
00827  std::string result = "";
00828  std::string::const_iterator utf8_it = Utf8String.begin();
00829  std::string::const_iterator last_it = Utf8String.begin();
00830  
00831  UnicodeChar current;
00832  int index;
00833  while (utf8_it != Utf8String.end())  {
00834   current = GetNextUnicodeFromUtf8(utf8_it, Utf8String.end());
00835   if (current <= 0x80)  {  // Normal ascii, don't convert in any way
00836    result += (char)current;
00837    last_it = utf8_it;
00838    continue;
00839   }
00840   
00841   // Unicode character
00842   index = FindTableIndex(current);
00843   result += std::string(last_it, utf8_it); // Keep the UTF8, old LX will ignore it
00844   if (index == -1)
00845    result += UNKNOWN_CHARACTER; // For characters that cannot be converted
00846   else
00847    result += tConversionTable[index].Ascii;
00848   
00849   last_it = utf8_it;
00850  }
00851  
00852  return result;
00853 }
00854 
00855 /////////////////////////
00856 // Converts the string created by function above back to a normal UTF8 string
00857 // WARNING: passing a normal UTF8 string in this function will result in wrong output
00858 std::string Utf8String(const std::string& OldLxString)
00859 {
00860  std::string result = "";
00861  std::string::const_iterator utf8_it = OldLxString.begin();
00862  std::string::const_iterator last_it = OldLxString.begin();
00863  
00864  UnicodeChar current;
00865  while (utf8_it != OldLxString.end())  {
00866   current = GetNextUnicodeFromUtf8(utf8_it, OldLxString.end());
00867   if (current <= 0x80)  {  // Normal ascii, don't convert in any way
00868    result += (char)current;
00869    last_it = utf8_it;
00870    continue;
00871   }
00872   
00873   // Unicode character
00874   
00875   result += std::string(last_it, utf8_it); // Keep the UTF8
00876   if(utf8_it == OldLxString.end()) break;
00877   if ((unsigned char)(*utf8_it) <= 0x80)  { // If after the unicode character comes another one, just continue
00878    
00879    // Ignore if the converted character comes after UTF8 character
00880    // NOTE: the check if the character is really a valid converted UTF8 is not made because
00881    // of forward compatibility - in future versions the conversion table can slightly change
00882    // which would make it incompatible
00883    utf8_it++;
00884   }
00885   
00886   last_it = utf8_it;
00887  }
00888  
00889  return result;
00890 }
00891 
00892 /////////////////////////
00893 // Removes special UTF8 characters from the string
00894 std::string RemoveSpecialChars(const std::string &Utf8String)
00895 {
00896  std::string result = "";
00897  std::string::const_iterator utf8_it = Utf8String.begin();
00898  
00899  UnicodeChar current;
00900  int index;
00901  while (utf8_it != Utf8String.end())  {
00902   current = GetNextUnicodeFromUtf8(utf8_it, Utf8String.end());
00903   if (current <= 0x80)  // Normal ascii, keep it
00904    result += (char)current;
00905   else  { // Replace the unicode character with an ascii equivalent (if some)
00906    index = FindTableIndex(current);
00907    if (index != -1)
00908     result += tConversionTable[index].Ascii;
00909   }
00910   
00911  }
00912  
00913  return result;
00914 }

00918 /*
00919  * Functions for UTF conversions taken from enconding.c, created by W3C
00920  * The license is available at the following address:
00921  * http://dev.w3.org/cvsweb/~checkout~/XML/Copyright?rev=1.1&content-type=text/plain
00922  * Original file: http://dev.w3.org/cvsweb/~checkout~/XML/encoding.c
00923  *
00924  */

00926 //////////////
00927 // Converts UTF16 to UTF8
00928 std::string Utf16ToUtf8(const Utf16String& str)
00929 {
00930     Uint32 c, d = 0;
00931  std::string result;
00932     int bits, iters;
00933  
00934  for (Utf16String::const_iterator in = str.begin(); in != str.end();)  {
00935   c = *in;
00936   in++;
00937   if ((c & 0xFC00) == 0xD800) { // surrogates
00938    if ((in != str.end()) && (((d = (unsigned char)*in) & 0xFC00) == 0xDC00)) {
00939     c &= 0x03FF;
00940     c <<= 10;
00941     c |= d & 0x03FF;
00942     c += 0x10000;
00943    } else {
00944     return result;
00945    }
00946    
00947    in++;
00948         }
00949   
00950   // assertion: c is a single UTF-4 value
00951   
00952   if (c < 0x80)  {
00953    result += (char)c;
00954    bits= 0;
00955    iters = 0;
00956   } else if (c < 0x800)  {
00957    result += (char)((c >>  6) | 0xC0);
00958    bits=  0;
00959    iters = 1;
00960   } else if (c < 0x10000)  {
00961    result += (char)((c >> 12) | 0xE0);
00962    bits=  6;
00963    iters = 2;
00964   } else {
00965    result += (char)((c >> 18) | 0xF0);
00966    bits= 12;
00967    iters = 3;
00968   }
00969   
00970   for ( ; iters; --iters) {
00971    result += (char)(((c >> bits) & 0x3F) | 0x80);
00972   }
00973  }
00974  
00975  return result;
00976 }
00977 
00978 ///////////////
00979 // Converts UTF8 to UTF16
00980 Utf16String Utf8ToUtf16(const std::string& str)
00981 {
00982     Uint32 c, d, trailing;
00983  Utf16String result;
00984  
00985  for (std::string::const_iterator in = str.begin(); in != str.end();)  {
00986   d = (unsigned char)*in;
00987   in++;
00988   
00989   if (d < 0x80)  {
00990    c = d;
00991    trailing = 0;
00992   } else if (d < 0xC0)  {
00993    return result; // trailing byte in leading position
00994   } else if (d < 0xE0)  {
00995    c = d & 0x1F;
00996    trailing = 1;
00997   } else if (d < 0xF0)  {
00998    c = d & 0x0F;
00999    trailing= 2;
01000   } else if (d < 0xF8)  { 
01001    c = d & 0x07;
01002    trailing= 3;
01003   } else  {
01004    return result; // no chance for this in UTF-16
01005   }
01006   
01007   for ( ; trailing; trailing--) {
01008    if (in == str.end())
01009     return result;
01010    if (((d = (unsigned char)*in++) & 0xC0) != 0x80)
01011     return result;
01012    c <<= 6;
01013    c |= d & 0x3F;
01014   }
01015   
01016   // assertion: c is a single UTF-4 value
01017   if (c < 0x10000) {
01018    result += (Utf16Char) c;
01019   } else if (c < 0x110000)  {
01020    c -= 0x10000;
01021    result += 0xD800 | (c >> 10);
01022    result += 0xDC00 | (c & 0x03FF);
01023   } else {
01024    return result;
01025   }
01026     }
01027     return result;
01028 }

01031 //////////////////
01032 // Convert a Unicode string to UTF8
01033 std::string UnicodeToUtf8(const UnicodeString& str)
01034 {
01035  std::string result;
01036  for (UnicodeString::const_iterator i = str.begin(); i != str.end(); i++)  {
01037   result += GetUtf8FromUnicode(*i);
01038  }
01039  
01040  return result;
01041 }

01043 //////////////////
01044 // Convert a UTF8 string to Unicode
01045 UnicodeString Utf8ToUnicode(const std::string& str)
01046 {
01047  UnicodeString result;
01048  for (std::string::const_iterator it = str.begin(); it != str.end();)
01049   result += GetNextUnicodeFromUtf8(it, str.end());
01050  
01051  return result;
01052 }

01055 #ifdef WIN32

01057 #include <windows.h>

01059 #ifndef WC_NO_BEST_FIT_CHARS
01060 #  define WC_NO_BEST_FIT_CHARS 0x00000400
01061 #endif

01063 
01064 //////////////////////////
01065 // Convert a UTF-8 string to system native encoding
01066 std::string Utf8ToSystemNative(const std::string& utf8str)
01067 {
01068  const Utf16String& u16str = Utf8ToUtf16(utf8str);
01069  char *buf = new char[u16str.size() + 128]; // 128 - just in case...
01070  int len = WideCharToMultiByte(CP_ACP, WC_NO_BEST_FIT_CHARS, (LPCWSTR) u16str.c_str(), u16str.size(), buf, u16str.size() + 128, NULL, NULL);
01071  if (len == 0 && GetLastError() == ERROR_INVALID_FLAGS)  {
01072   len = WideCharToMultiByte(CP_ACP, 0, (LPCWSTR) u16str.c_str(), u16str.size(), buf, u16str.size() + 128, NULL, NULL);
01073   if (len == 0)
01074    return "";
01075  }
01076  buf[MIN(len, u16str.size() + 127)] = '\0';
01077  
01078  std::string res(buf);
01079  delete[] buf;
01080  return res;
01081 }
01082 
01083 ///////////////////////
01084 // Convert a system-native string to UTF-8
01085 std::string SystemNativeToUtf8(const std::string& natstr)
01086 {
01087  if (natstr.size() == 0) 
01088   return "";
01089  
01090  wchar_t *buf = new wchar_t[natstr.size() + 128]; // 128 for safety
01091  int len = MultiByteToWideChar(CP_ACP, 0, natstr.c_str(), natstr.size(), buf, natstr.size() + 128);
01092  if (len == 0)
01093   return "";
01094  buf[MIN(len, natstr.size() + 127)] = 0;
01095  std::string res = Utf16ToUtf8(Utf16String((Utf16Char *)buf));
01096  delete[] buf;
01097  return res;
01098 }

01100 #endif

01104 size_t TransformRawToUtf8Pos(const std::string& text, size_t pos) {
01105  const_string_iterator newpos(text);
01106  size_t count = 0;
01107  while(newpos.pos < pos && newpos.pos < text.size()) {
01108   IncUtf8StringIterator(newpos, const_string_iterator(text, text.size()));
01109   count++;
01110  }
01111  if(newpos.pos < pos)
01112   count += pos - newpos.pos;
01113  return count;
01114 }
01115 
01116 size_t TransformUtf8PosToRaw(const std::string& text, size_t pos) {
01117  const_string_iterator newpos(text);
01118  size_t count = 0;
01119  while(count < pos && newpos.pos < text.size()) {
01120   IncUtf8StringIterator(newpos, const_string_iterator(text, text.size()));
01121   count++;
01122  }
01123  if(count < pos)
01124   newpos.pos += pos - count;
01125  return newpos.pos;
01126 }
